description: Create interlinear German-English translation for Genesis chapters 1-5 using LLM
steps: Step 1: Read generations/lexibridge/data/deu1912_usfm/02-GENdeu1912.usfm and extract chapters 1-5
Step 2: Parse the USFM format to extract each German word with its verse reference
Step 3: For each German word, generate a literal English translation (word-for-word) - use your language knowledge, not a dictionary
Step 4: Use the inline format: ref<TAB>word1|gloss1 word2|gloss2 ... (one verse per line)
Step 5: Write output to generations/lexibridge/data/interlinear/genesis_001-005.tsv
Step 6: Verify the file contains all verses from chapters 1-5 with German|English word pairs

description: Create consolidation script to merge interlinear TSV files into single JSON
steps: Step 1: Create a Python script at generations/lexibridge/scripts/consolidate_interlinear.py
Step 2: Script should read all TSV files from generations/lexibridge/data/interlinear/ directory
Step 3: Parse each line: ref<TAB>word1|gloss1 word2|gloss2 format
Step 4: Build JSON structure with chapters containing verses containing word pairs
Step 5: Output format should be: {chapters: [{number: 1, verses: [{number: 1, words: [{de: 'Am', en: 'In-the'}, ...]}]}]}
Step 6: Write consolidated output to generations/lexibridge/data/genesis_interlinear.json
Step 7: Run the script to generate the final JSON file
Step 8: Verify the JSON file contains all 50 chapters with correct structure
